name: dispiriting
content:

causing you to not have much hope about a particular situation or problem: It was a bit dispiriting to see so few people at the meeting. There has been a dispiriting fall in sales. See
dispirited
More examplesFewer examplesIt was very dispiriting to see people who I thought were friends turn away from me.The prospect of a long delay was dispiriting.The average car or truck loses a dispiriting 38% of its value in one year.It turned out to be a dispiriting year for him and his party.The report is a fascinating and dispiriting read.
